text: A good moisturizer is the key to any beauty routine, but the wrong one can spell disaster for those with oily skin. Too much moisture will clog pores and possibly increase your skin ’ s oil production, which leads to dreaded breakouts. So to avoid a catastrophic skin event, we went to an expert. We asked Audrey Kunin, board - certified dermatologist and founder of DERMAdoctor, what we should look for when it comes to moisturizers for oily skin. “ Regardless of skin type, your moisturizer label should say it ’ s non - comedogenic, meaning it will not plug pores or trigger acne, ” says Dr. Kunin. “ This is especially important if you tend to have oily skin. ” Dr. Kunin notes
